title: Which serif for FF Milo Text?
content:
Hello,

i'm searching for an antiqua or a antiqua-like slab-serif as a compagnion for [FF Milo](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143227/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=FF.11670.0.0).  
FF Milo has (extremely) short ascenders and descenders - so the "classic" antiquas don't really go with it, i think. One i found so far, is Arnhem (OurType) – do you have other suggestions? Arnhem has a quite similar x-height, but Arnhem offers a different Capital-M, which could be a problem.  
The face should offer OSF and a minimal range of weights – regular, italic, bold, bold italic.

Thanks in advance, T.
author: poms

comments.content: Without fully testing, [Dolly](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143227/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=UW.113565.0.0) or [Fedra Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143227/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=fedra%20serif) might work.

Thank you for your suggestions - x-height/short stems/antiqua(-like), the right "M", all matches – but

After i printed the Fedra Serif A PDF, i think, it speaks too loud for Milo.  
Dolly is versatile, but this time not, not with Milo.  
Chapparal Pro, i always forget this CS font, pardon i don't like it that much aesthetically.  
I mess around with the PDF of Gerard Ungers Capitolium (and C. News)– that looks promising, but it is quite expensive…

We don't stop here :) Please more

Unger's [Oranda](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143227/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=oranda) might be the thing. Sorry, no OSF.

Also [FF Olsen](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424143227/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=olsen)
